name: Stout Barbecue Sauce
description: Winter is a call for us to beef up the heartiness of just about everything. Though I'm not normally a huge fan of stout beers, when the frigid cold has set in, there's something appealing to drinking what feels like a meal in a bottle. I wanted to take that appropriate seasonal heaviness and apply it to a barbecue sauce. So I married the two to create a stout barbecue sauce.
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onion and cook until lightly browned, about 7 to 8 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Stir in the tomato sauce, beer, molasses, mustard, vinegar, brown sugar and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil, then reduce to simmer and cook until sauce is reduced to a medium-thin thickness, about 30 to 45 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer the sauce to a blender and puree until smooth. Allow the sauce to cool, then store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.
